data.enText: size

data.chText: （尤指与其他事物相比较时的）规模，范围，程度
data.enText: the size or extent of sth, especially when compared with sth else
They entertain on a large scale (= they hold expensive parties with a lot of guests) .

data.chText: 这里的腐败现象曾十分严重。
data.enText: Here was corruption on a grand scale .

data.chText: 全球77%的能量产生自化石燃料。
data.enText: On a global scale, 77% of energy is created from fossil fuels.
to achieve economies of scale in production (= to produce many items so the cost of producing each one is reduced)

data.chText: 这场灾难的深重程度是无法充分认识的。
data.enText: It was impossible to comprehend the full scale of the disaster.

data.chText: 直到早晨才看清了损害的严重程度。
data.enText: It was not until morning that the sheer scale of the damage could be seen (= how great it was) .
range of levels
a range of levels or numbers used for measuring sth
a five-point pay scale
to evaluate performance on a scale from 1 to 10
the set of all the different levels of sth, from the lowest to the highest

data.chText: 对于处在社会最底层的人来说，生活就是为吃饱肚子而不断挣扎的过程。
data.enText: At the other end of the scale , life is a constant struggle to get enough to eat.
the social scale
marks for measuring
a series of marks at regular intervals on an instrument that is used for measuring
How much does it read on the scale?
weighing instrument
scale
an instrument for weighing people or things
bathroom/kitchen/weighing scales
the scales of justice (= represented as the two pans on a balance 5 )
of map/diagram/model
the relation between the actual size of sth and its size on a map, diagram or model that represents it
a scale of 1:25 000

data.chText: 按比例缩放的模型 / 图画
data.enText: a scale model/drawing

data.chText: 两张平面图是按同一比例绘制的。
data.enText: Both plans are drawn to the same scale.

data.chText: 这个示意图是按比例画的吗？
data.enText: Is this diagram to scale (= are all its parts the same size and shape in relation to each other as they are in the thing represented) ?
in music
a series of musical notes moving upwards or downwards, with fixed intervals between each note, especially a series of eight starting on a particular note
the scale of C major
to practise scales on the piano
of fish/reptile
any of the thin plates of hard material that cover the skin of many fish and reptiles
in water pipes, etc.
fur
a hard greyish-white substance that is sometimes left inside water pipes and containers for heating water
on teeth
a hard substance that forms on teeth, especially when they are not cleaned regularly
tip the balance/scales
swing the balance

data.chText: 使天平倾斜；使结果倾向某方；起决定性作用
data.enText: to affect the result of sth in one way rather than another

data.chText: 在面试中，机敏的表现是一种有利的条件。
data.enText: In an interview, smart presentation can tip the scales in your favour.
climb
to climb to the top of sth very high and steep

data.chText: 第一位登上世界五大高峰的女性
data.enText: the first woman to scale the world's five highest peaks

data.chText: 他登上了他事业的顶峰。
data.enText: He has scaled the heights of his profession.
fish
to remove the small flat hard pieces of skin from a fish
teeth
to remove tartar from the teeth by scraping

data.chText: 牙医为我刮除牙石，抛光了牙齿。
data.enText: The dentist scaled and polished my teeth.
change size
to change the size of sth

data.chText: 正文可以从4点变到108点，但印刷质量丝毫不会降低。
data.enText: Text can be scaled from 4 points to 108 points without any loss of quality.
scale sth↔down
scale sth↔back

data.chText: 减少（数量）；缩小（规模或范围）
data.enText: to reduce the number, size or extent of sth

data.chText: 我们考虑在明年缩小培训计划。
data.enText: We are thinking of scaling down our training programmes next year.

data.chText: 国际货币基金组织已经调低了它对未来十年的增长预测。
data.enText: The IMF has scaled back its growth forecasts for the next decade.
scale sth↔up
to increase the size or number of sth

means: (尤指与其他事物相比较时的)范围

data.enText: tip the balance/scales
swing the balance

data.chText: 使天平倾斜；使结果倾向某方；起决定性作用
data.enText: to affect the result of sth in one way rather than another

data.chText: 在面试中，机敏的表现是一种有利的条件。
data.enText: In an interview, smart presentation can tip the scales in your favour.
scale sth↔down
scale sth↔back

data.chText: 减少（数量）；缩小（规模或范围）
data.enText: to reduce the number, size or extent of sth

data.chText: 我们考虑在明年缩小培训计划。
data.enText: We are thinking of scaling down our training programmes next year.

data.chText: 国际货币基金组织已经调低了它对未来十年的增长预测。
data.enText: The IMF has scaled back its growth forecasts for the next decade.
scale sth↔up
to increase the size or number of sth

tr: a flattened rigid plate forming part of the body covering of many animals
a metal sheathing of uniform thickness (such as the shield attached to an artillery piece to protect the gunners)
an indicator having a graduated sequence of marks
(music) a series of notes differing in pitch according to a specific scheme (usually within an octave)
a thin flake of dead epidermis shed from the surface of the skin
a specialized leaf or bract that protects a bud or catkin

example: they entertained on a grand scale

tr: the ratio between the size of something and a representation of it

example: judging on a scale of 1 to 10

tr: size or measure according to a scale
example: This model must be scaled down

tr: measure with or as if with scales
pattern, make, regulate, set, measure, or estimate according to some rate or standard
climb up by means of a ladder
take by attacking with scaling ladders
example: The troops scaled the walls of the fort

tr: measure by or as if by a scale

value.def: If you refer to the scale of something, you are referring to its size or extent, especially when it is very big.

example.ex: However, he underestimates the scale of the problem...
example.tran: 然而，他低估了问题的严重性。

example.ex: You may feel dwarfed by the sheer scale of the place...
example.tran: 看到此处气势如此恢宏，你可能会觉得自己很渺小。

example.ex: The breakdown of law and order could result in killing on a massive scale...
example.tran: 法治一旦崩溃可能导致大肆杀戮。

example.ex: The British aid programme is small in scale.
example.tran: 英国的援助项目规模不大。

value.tran: 大小;(尤指庞大的)规模,范围,程度

value.def: A scale is a set of levels or numbers which are used in a particular system of measuring things or are used when comparing things.

example.ex: ...an earthquake measuring five-point-five on the Richter scale...
The patient rates the therapies on a scale of zero to ten...
example.tran: 患者按十分制给这些治疗方法打分。

example.ex: The higher up the social scale they are, the more the men have to lose.
example.tran: 社会地位越高，失去的东西就越多。

value.def: A pay scale or scale of fees is a list that shows how much someone should be paid, depending, for example, on their age or what work they do.

example.ex: ...those on the high end of the pay scale...
A Registered Osteopath will be pleased to tell you his scale of fees before you decide on a consultation.
example.tran: 在病人决定是否就诊之前，注册整骨医师会很乐意告知其收费标准。

value.tran: (根据年龄、工种等核定的工资或费用)级别,标准

value.def: The scale of a map, plan, or model is the relationship between the size of something in the map, plan, or model and its size in the real world.

example.ex: The map, on a scale of 1:10,000, shows over 5,000 individual paths.
example.tran: 该地图以 1:10,000 的比例尺显示了 5,000 多条不同道路。

value.tran: (地图、图纸、模型的)比例，比例尺

value.def: A scale model or scale replica of a building or object is a model of it which is smaller than the real thing but has all the same parts and features.

example.ex: Franklin made his mother an intricately detailed scale model of the house.
example.tran: 富兰克林为他的母亲制作了一个复杂精细的房屋模型。

value.tran: (模型或复制品)按比例缩小的

value.def: In music, a scale is a fixed sequence of musical notes, each one higher than the next, which begins at a particular note.
The scales of a fish or reptile are the small, flat pieces of hard skin that cover its body.
Scales are a piece of equipment used for weighing things, for example for weighing amounts of food that you need in order to make a particular meal.

example.ex: I step on the scales practically every morning.
example.tran: 我几乎每天早上都称一下体重。

value.def: If you scale something such as a mountain or a wall, you climb up it or over it.

example.ex: In 1981, five members of a climbing party died while scaling Mount Hood.
example.tran: 1981 年，一支登山队的5名队员在攀登胡德峰时遇难。

example.ex: The men scaled a wall and climbed down scaffolding on the other side.
example.tran: 那些男人攀上一堵墙然后顺着另一侧的脚手架爬了下去。

value.def: If something is out of scale with the things near it, it is too big or too small in relation to them.

example.ex: The tower was surmounted by an enormous statue, utterly out of scale with the building.
example.tran: 那座塔的顶部矗立着一尊巨型雕像，与整个建筑完全不成比例。

gramarinfo.label: usu v-link PHR, oft PHR <l>with</l> n

value.def: If the different parts of a map, drawing, or model are to scale, they are the right size in relation to each other.

example.ex: ...a miniature garden, with little pagodas and bridges all to scale.
example.tran: 内有全部按比例建造的小塔和小桥的微缩花园

trans: 里氏震级；里氏；里克特震级；里氏震级表
灰阶；灰度等级；灰度级；灰度模式；灰度
工业规模；生产规模；工业秤
全尺寸（的）；一比一的；足尺（比例）；全（满）刻度；全标度
小规模；小尺度；小试；小范围；小鳞片
大规模地；大规模；大量；大规模的
大规模的；大范围的；大型的；(地图或简图)大比例尺的
